name: undogmatic
content:

not having or agreeing with fixed beliefs about a subject; not thinking that you are always right and everyone else is wrong: This fresh, undogmatic, flexible approach freed us from the familiar patterns of thinking and feeling that we had grown up with. We were taught that Confucius was a liberal, humane, and undogmatic thinker. Opposite
dogmaticCompare
